title: Problem 5
content:
(20 points)

Here are some words and word combinations in Northwest Gbaya and their English translations in arbitrary order:

| Northwest Gbaya           | Translation           |
|---------------------------|-----------------------|
| Páá                       |                       |
| Páá náng nú kò            |                       |
| Páá sèè                   |                       |
| búmá yı́k                  |                       |
| búmá zù yı́k               |                       |
| dáng gòk                  |                       |
| dı́ fò                     |                       |
| dı́ sèè                    |                       |
| kò yı́k                    |                       |
| kò zòk                    |                       |
| náng wı́                   |                       |
| nú fò                     |                       |
| nú lébé                   |                       |
| sèè wı́                    |                       |
| yı́k                       |                       |
| yı́k wı́                    |                       |
| zù                        |                       |
|---------------------------|-----------------------|
| Translation               | Northwest Gbaya       |
|---------------------------|-----------------------|
| at the surface            |                       |
| eye socket                |                       |
| eyebrow                   |                       |
| eyelash                   |                       |
| eyes/face                 |                       |
| field edge                |                       || foot                      |                       |
| happiness                 |                       |
| liver                     |                       |
| good field                |                       |
| nostril                   |                       |
| above, on                 |                       |
| poisonous snake           |                       |
| tip of the tongue         |                       |
| to be dying               |                       |
| to envy                   |                       |
| to put                    |                       |

(a) Determine the correct correspondences.

(b) Translate into English: búmá zù, kò, lébé gòk, lébé wı́.

(c) Translate into Northwest Gbaya: at the center, head, displeasure, nose.

△! The Northwest Gbaya language belongs to the Ubangian family. It is spoken by approx. 200,000 people in the Central African Republic.
The Northwest Gbaya words are given in a simplied transcription. ? is a consonant.
-Boris Iomdin

---

Good luck!
